definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Li and Lin became quarrelsome lovers.
Then again, it's always been a mixed relationship between the two.
sentences.chinese: 總之，兩國一直都是一對歡喜冤家。

sentences.english: After many years, the two have met did not know, has become a joy enemy.
sentences.chinese: 多年後，兩人見面已不相識，卻成了一對歡喜冤家。

definition: lit. the lioness from Hedong roars (idiom)/fig. refers to a shrewish wife or a henpecked husband
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
to have no sense of shame/brazen
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
partner for dating/a date (boyfriend or girlfriend)
to agree on three laws (idiom)/three-point covenant/(fig.) preliminary agreement/basic rules
to make friends again/to renew old cordial relations
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4
